Docs.summary: Retains data-binding expressions and static literal text. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBoundLiteralControl> class persists the value of its <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBoundLiteralControl.Text%2A> property to view state.
## Examples The following code example creates a class that obtains a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBoundLiteralControl> object and displays the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBoundLiteralControl.Text%2A> property of the object.
[!code-csharp[SystemWebUI_DataBoundLiteralControl#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/SystemWebUI_DataBoundLiteralControl/CS/mydataboundliteralcontrol.cs#1)] [!code-vb[SystemWebUI_DataBoundLiteralControl#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/SystemWebUI_DataBoundLiteralControl/VB/mydataboundliteralcontrol.vb#1)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks This implementation of the <xref:System.Web.UI.ITextControl> interface returns the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBoundLiteralControl.Text%2A> property. The value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBoundLiteralControl.Text%2A> property is persisted in the view state.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBoundLiteralControl> object implements <xref:System.Web.UI.ITextControl> but does not support the `set` method on the <xref:System.Web.UI.ITextControl.Text%2A> property. All attempts to use this method will return a <xref:System.NotSupportedException> exception.

Docs.exception: An attempt to set the value is made.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBoundLiteralControl> class persists the value of its <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBoundLiteralControl.Text%2A> property to view state.
## Examples The following code example creates a custom control and uses that control from within an .aspx file to display the text of a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBoundLiteralControl> object. The custom control obtains a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBoundLiteralControl> object and outputs the text property in its `Render` method.
[!code-csharp[SystemWebUI_DataBoundLiteralControl#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/SystemWebUI_DataBoundLiteralControl/CS/mydataboundliteralcontrol.cs#1)] [!code-vb[SystemWebUI_DataBoundLiteralControl#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/SystemWebUI_DataBoundLiteralControl/VB/mydataboundliteralcontrol.vb#1)]
You can compile the control with the Visual Basic Compiler (vbc.exe) or C# Compiler (csc.exe). You must place the resulting .dll file in the Bin directory of the Web project, as shown in the following code example.
```vb vbc /r:System.dll /r:System.Web.dll /t:library /out:myWebAppPath/bin/vb_myDataBoundLiteralControl.dll myDataBoundLiteralControl.vb ```
```csharp csc /t:library /out:myWebAppPath/bin/cs_myDataBoundLiteralControl.dll myDataBoundLiteralControl.cs ```
The following code example demonstrates how the custom control is registered and used within an .aspx file.
[!code-aspx-csharp[SystemWebUI_DataBoundLiteralControl#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/SystemWebUI_DataBoundLiteralControl/CS/databoundform.aspx#2)] [!code-aspx-vb[SystemWebUI_DataBoundLiteralControl#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/SystemWebUI_DataBoundLiteralControl/VB/databoundform.aspx#2)]
